intro: Mirabilis nyctaginea var. setigera, commonly known as the night blooming cereus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that open at night and emit a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant has a succulent stem with spiny, lance-shaped leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. Its flowers are typically pink to reddish in color and can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique nocturnal blooming habit.
